project.description: Manage user git credentials on notebook server.

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Service_base_name
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: unique infrastructure value that previously was used when ssn being provisioned

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Notebook_Name
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: name of the notebook to start

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: Username
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: name of the data scientist user

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: SSH_Key_Name
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: name of the uploaded ssh key file (without ".pem")

hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.name: Region
hudson.model.ChoiceParameterDefinition.description: aws region where infrastructure was deployed

hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.name: git_creds
hudson.model.StringParameterDefinition.description: Dictionary of git credentials in json format. For example: { "username": "Test User", "email": "test@example.com", "hostname": "github.com", "login": "testlogin", "password": "testpassword" } Fileds "username" and "email" used for commits (display Author). Leave "hostname" field empty to apply login/password by default for all services

hudson.tasks.Shell.command: creds=$git_creds; rand=`openssl rand -hex 10`; echo $rand; sudo docker run -i -v /home/$os_user/keys:/root/keys -v /opt/dlab/tmp/result:/response -e "conf_resource=notebook" -e "request_id=$rand" -e "conf_os_user=$os_user" -e "conf_service_base_name=$Service_base_name" -e "edge_user_name=$Username" -e "aws_region=$Region" -e "notebook_instance_name=$Notebook_Name" -e "conf_key_name=$SSH_Key_Name" -e "git_creds=$creds" -e "application=$notebook_app" docker.dlab-$notebook_app --action $Action
